properties.areaDesc: Foggy Bottom; Tulare County; West Side Hills; Eastern Kern County; Fresno; Western San Joaquin Valley; Bakersfield; San Joaquin Confluence; Western Kern County; Southern Kings County; Merced and Madera
properties.headline: Freeze Watch issued February 1 at 1:15PM PST until February 4 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Hanford CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, northwest winds 10 to 20 mph with
gusts up to 35 mph expected along with areas of blowing dust.
For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures with minimum
temperatures as low as 25 degrees in the coldest locations.

* WHERE...The central and southern San Joaquin Valley.

* WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, from noon to 10 PM PST Sunday.
For the Freeze Watch, from late Monday night through Tuesday
morning.

* IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree
limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result.
Frost and below freezing temperatures could kill crops, frost
sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor
plumbing.
properties.instruction:
Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high
profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent
freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should
be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have
in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above-
ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 10 PM PST SUNDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING
